summary: Request to clarify the WorkflowClient API by distinguishing between Workflow Stub objects (typed interfaces) and Proxy objects (that implement user-defined Workflow interfaces). Currently, methods with 'Stub' postfix are inconsistentâ€”some return WorkflowStubInterface while others return proxies, creating confusion and limiting access to stub functionality.
userImpact: Users face inconsistent behavior when creating workflow stubs and cannot reliably obtain WorkflowStubInterface for operations like Describe or Update with custom WaitPolicy.
rootCause: API design inconsistency where methods with 'Stub' suffix have different return types (some return WorkflowStubInterface, others return proxy objects), causing confusion about which method to use.
proposedFix: Introduce new methods: newWorkflow/newRunningWorkflow for typed stubs, newWorkflowProxy/newRunningWorkflowProxy for proxies, newUntypedWorkflow/newUntypedRunningWorkflow for untyped stubs; deprecate existing methods with backward compatibility parameter.
keyQuote: there is no proper way to get WorkflowStubInterface from a Workflow class. Both methods that accept a class return us a proxy.
